titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: Katherine I. Woods (1886-1968) was an author, editor, and translator. She reviewed books for the New York Times Book Review and was the book review editor for Tomorrow. Perhaps the most notable among her translations was The Little Prince, by Antoine de Saint-Exupery.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of correspondence, manuscripts, photographs, and diaries of Katherine I. Woods. The correspondence is both professional and personal. Professional correspondents include Pearl Buck, Kay Boyle, Ida Tarbell, Eudora Welty, and Andre Maurois. The diaries and photographs document Woods' travels in Europe. There are daily calendar journals from selected years in the first half of the 20th century that detail Woods' work and her life after retirement. The collection also includes the European travel diaries of Edith Huntington Snow, caricatures by Enrico Caruso, and typed manuscripts of stories and translations by Woods.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

otherfindaid.p: An inventory is available in the repository.
